description:
Oryctolagus cuniculus cuniculus, also known as the European rabbit or common rabbit, is a subspecies of the European rabbit (Oryctolagus cuniculus). It is a small mammal belonging to the family Leporidae.

The Oryctolagus cuniculus cuniculus is a herbivorous, burrowing animal with a distinctive long-eared, short-tailed appearance. It has a compact, rounded body covered in soft, dense fur that ranges in color from shades of brown to gray. The subspecies is known for its strong hind legs, which enable it to run and jump quickly to evade predators.

Oryctolagus cuniculus cuniculus is native to the Iberian Peninsula and parts of North Africa. It is a highly adaptable species that has been introduced to various regions around the world, where it has become an invasive species in some areas.

The European rabbit is an important prey species, contributing to the food chain in its native and introduced habitats. It is also valued for its meat and fur, and has been domesticated as a livestock animal and as a pet.
